source.title: Ten year anniversary charge - Tony's trust

testCase.description: Basic 10-year anniversary charge calculation for discretionary trust
testCase.scenario: Trust reaches 10-year anniversary. Notional lifetime transfer is £450,000 with available nil rate band of £275,000. Calculate the periodic charge.

calculationNotes: Notional transfer = relevant property (£450,000) + related settlements (£0) = £450,000
Step 4: Apply 3/10 multiplier for periodic charge
Actual charge £10,498.50 < £27,000, so no capping required
hmrcQuote: Tony's notional transfer was £450,000 with an available nil rate band of £275,000. The difference is £175,000. 20% of £175,000 is £35,000. The effective rate is £35,000 / £450,000 = 7.777%. Multiplied by 3/10 gives a rate of 2.333%. The tax due is £10,498.50.
